A careless admin leaked half his RSA private key on a public forum. Can you recover the original message from 3841799647916612305800716016286841330454907240225939465456748489104796352216649205935887265989909900960053777900162674417098639426184051425029735309117904 using only this partial key exposure?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7799037055366529120073038020799184578347504396103133021733830433816882464372341436993362336734179549291672855739602588416650082859893278510219458095734463, e=4603584781185707109153164638877437842678395919082557256817571900952838450740835761098459833234595077631426311833590466030004750343095138527997128901835499, partial_p=13262523726948807998

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{08w4i8tn}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3841799647916612305800716016286841330454907240225939465456748489104796352216649205935887265989909900960053777900162674417098639426184051425029735309117904
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7799037055366529120073038020799184578347504396103133021733830433816882464372341436993362336734179549291672855739602588416650082859893278510219458095734463, e=4603584781185707109153164638877437842678395919082557256817571900952838450740835761098459833234595077631426311833590466030004750343095138527997128901835499, partial_p=13262523726948807998
extra_info: p=83250210702037391750199952576471905313441893015671970187964504583771140796071, q=93681889686504570142578769329671196462665038927170067863188080394190994483753, Ï†(n)=7799037055366529120073038020799184578347504396103133021733830433816882464372164504892973794772286770569766712637826481484707240821842125925241495960454640
